Sentencas: The H2S tolerance and stability of a Sm0.2Ce0.8O2-delta coating on the Ni/YSZ anode pore wall surface was investigated.
Titulo: Effects of the Sm0.2Ce0.8O2-δ Modification of a Ni-Based Anode on the H2S Tolerance for Intermediate Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The sulfur poisoning mechanisms were studied for various H2S concentrations (0-100 ppm) and temperatures (600 degrees C and 700 degrees C) under both open circuit voltage (OCV) and current-loading conditions.
Titulo: Effects of the Sm0.2Ce0.8O2-δ Modification of a Ni-Based Anode on the H2S Tolerance for Intermediate Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: For the unmodified Ni/YSZ anode under current-loading conditions, the cell performance decreased significantly with the introduction of H2S, as the sulfur strongly adsorbed at the electrochemical reaction sites (ERSs).
Titulo: Effects of the Sm0.2Ce0.8O2-δ Modification of a Ni-Based Anode on the H2S Tolerance for Intermediate Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: For the SDC-modified Ni/YSZ anode under the OCV conditions, the governing mechanism of the H2S poisoning was the formation of Ce2O2S with low oxygen ion conductivities, making the oxygen ion path disconnected.
Titulo: Effects of the Sm0.2Ce0.8O2-δ Modification of a Ni-Based Anode on the H2S Tolerance for Intermediate Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: For the SDC-modified anode under current-loading conditions, the mixed ionic and electronic conductivity (MIEC) of the SDC allowed the electrochemical reactions to occur mainly at the SDC/fuel interface (2PB).
Titulo: Effects of the Sm0.2Ce0.8O2-δ Modification of a Ni-Based Anode on the H2S Tolerance for Intermediate Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: With these conditions, the adsorbed sulfur was easily removed by the electrochemical oxidation.
Titulo: Effects of the Sm0.2Ce0.8O2-δ Modification of a Ni-Based Anode on the H2S Tolerance for Intermediate Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The decrease in the sulfur poisoning effect resulted in stable cell performances at 500 ppm of H2S over 800 h. (C) 2012 The Electrochemical Society.
Titulo: Effects of the Sm0.2Ce0.8O2-δ Modification of a Ni-Based Anode on the H2S Tolerance for Intermediate Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
